You leave this availability statement intact.
You offer Perseus any modifications you make.

notesStmt.note: Additional XML cleanup by Alpheios Technical Services, LLC.

div2.entryFree:
ka *
prefixed to a noun is called kaAfu Alt~a$obiyhi The k of comparison. Respecting its being prefixed to pronouns, see A^ano, suprà, p. 106. ― -b2- A_ijoEalo h`*aA Al$~aYo'a kaA^osFA waAHidFA Make thou this thing to be [uniform, or] of one way, or mode, or manner. (ISk, in TA, art. bA^j.) ― -b3- ka*`lika The like thereof; such like; and simply such; and so. ― -b4- kaA_K and kA='K: see kaA^aY~K or kaA^ay~ino voce A^aY~N. ― -b5- kamaA followed by a pret. often means Like as when: see an ex. in a verse cited above, p. 740. ― -b6- kamaA is often followed by a pret. in the sense of an aor.: see exs. in EM., pp. 41 & 214. ― -b7- kamaA A^anota waziyodFA [Keep as, or where, thou art, and approach not Zeyd! like makaAnaka wazayodFA]. Heard by Ks. (L, art. End.) ― -b8- kamaAA^anotaniY Wait for me where thou art! Heard by Az from certain of the Benoo-Suleym. (L, art. End.) ― -b9- k of allocution is varied like the pronominal affix of the sec. pers., accord. to the sex and number of the persons addressed: see exs. in the Kur, iii. 42 and xix. 21 (Flügel's ed., and Lees' Keshsháf), xii. 37, ii. 46, &c., and xii. 32. But sometimes the same form is used in addressing a number of persons as in addressing one man: see, for ex., Kur, iv. 96.

1 kabana *
: see Sabana. ― -b2- kabana Alv~awoba: see gabana.

kabaA *
: said of a horse: see above, art. Hana*a, p. 656 b. ― -b2- See also a phrase voce sal~apN. ― -b3- kabaA He fell upon his face: (K, TA:) or so kabaA liwajohihi: S, TA:) and kabAa also signifies Eavara [he stumbled, or tripped]. (TA.)

R. Q. 1 katokata *
: see TaHoTaHa.

kutokutN *
The coarse part of silk, and of tow, &c.

kitaAbN *
(same as EaqodN) The ceremony (not certificate) of a marriage-contract. katabuwAkitaAbahu EalaY fulaAnapK They performed the ceremony of the contract of his marriage to such a woman (same as EqdwA Eaqodahu). ― -b2- A^aholu AlkitaAbi: see A^aholN.

katifN *
[The shoulder-blade;] a wide bone behind the shoulder-joint. (Mgh.) ― -b2- [Hence, The shoulder itself.] See Tur~apN and muw^ur~abN.

kuitofAanN *
, as an epithet applied to the locust, see in TA, voce musay~aHN. See also jaraAdN.

kitaAfN *
of a zabiyl: see HatiY~N.

katiyfapN *
i. q. Dab~apN A broad piece of iron. A poet speaks of a wooden vessel of which a fracture is mended with a ktyfp. (S.)

2 kat~alahu *
, inf. n. takotiylN, He made it (A^aqiT [&c.]) into lumps, or compact pieces or portions. (TA.) ― -b2- And He, or it, fattened him. (Kr, TA.)

5 takat~ala *
It became compacted together in a mass; it became lumpy. See qiyda, art. qwd.

kutolapN *
A lump, or compact piece or portion, (S, M, * Msb, K,) of a thing, (Msb,) or of gum, &c., (S,) or of dates, and of clay, &c.: (M, K:) a piece, or portion, of dates packed together in a receptacle: (Mgh:) and a piece of flesh-meat. (K.)

ktlp *
i. q. zabiylN. (TA in art. HSn.)

mikotalN *
A zinobiyl, (Msb, K,) or thing like a zinobiyl, [or zabiyl,] (S,) holding fifteen measures of the quantity termed SaAE; (S, K;) it is a thing [or basket] made of palm-leaves, in which dates, &c., are carried. (Msb.)

mukat~alN *
Round and compact; (K;) applied to a head: (TA:) short (S, K, TA) and strong: (TA:) a man thick in body, (K, TA,) compact therein, and inclining to shortness. (TA.)

1 katama *
, aor.
katuma
, inf. n. katomN [and kitomaAnN], doubly trans., He concealed, or suppressed, a secret. (Mgh.) ― -b2- katama Alr~abowa: see a verse cited in the last paragraph of art. Ewr.

5 takat~ama *
(K, art. dls) He (a man) concealed, or hid, himself. (T, K, same art.)

6 takaAtamuwA *
They practised concealment, one with another: see tadaAfanuwA.

kaAtimN *
meaning makotuwmN: see daAfiqN, in two places. ― -b2- fiY kaAtimi Als~ir~i: see a verse cited in conj. 3 of art. ErD.

katanN *
for kat~aAnN: see an ex. in a verse cited voce $aAribN.

kuj~apN *
, see bukosapN in the K and TA.

4 A^akoHaTa *
: see A^aqoHaTa, in two places.

1 kaHala *
(assumed tropical:) He put out, or blinded, an eye with a heated nail, &c.: see an ex. voce samara.

8 maA A@kotaHalotu gamaADFA * and gimaADFA
&c.: see A^agomaDa. See also HavAavN.

10 AisotakoHala Als~ahara *
(assumed tropical:) [He became sleepless; as though he took sleeplessness as a collyrium]. (TA in art. Hls, from a trad.)

kaHolN *
and kaHolu (S, K) A year of drought, barrenness, or dearth; (S;) a hard year. (K.)

kuHayolN *
a proper name for A horse of high breed; as also ↓kuHayolAanN. (TA.) ― -b2- kuHayolN Tar (qaTiraAn) in the dial. of El-Hijáz. (TA, voce garobN; from the T.) See nfoZN.

kuHayolAanN *
: see kuHayolN.

EayonN kaHolaA='u *
An eye that is black, [or black in the edges of the lids,] by nature, as though it had kuHol applied to it. (Mgh.) Not in the TA. [It seems to have both of these meanings.]

kaHolaA='u *
A certain plant: see K, voce $inojaAr: calendula arvensis: see Delile, Flor. Aeg., no. 864.

AlA^akoHalu *
The median vein. See wariydN and A^abojalu and A^aboharu and AlS~aAfinu.

1 kadama *
He bit with the fore part of the mouth. (S, Msb, K.)

6 takaAdumu AlHumuri *
[The wild asses' biting one another with the fore part of the mouth]. (TA in art. sHj.) See also tasaAn~at.

ka*obaAnuwnapN *
[Pers. kadobaAnw] An intelligent housewife, who is a good manager. (K, art. hlj; but omitted in some copies.)

ku*iynaqN *
: see midaq~N, in art. dq~.

entryFree.key: flAn yukaArizu En AlHq AlY AlbATl

div2.entryFree:
3 flAn yukaArizu En AlHq AlY AlbATl *
, inf. n. mukaArazapN: i. q. yuEaAjizu, expl. in art. Ejz. (TA, art. Ejz.)

7 Ainokarasa fiY Al$~aYo'i *
He entered into the thing and concealed himself. (IKtt, in TA, art. nms.)

kurosiY~u AlxaAtami *
(T, K, art. bZr) The bezel of the ring. (TK.)

kirosan~apN *
, thus written: (TA:) [Bitter vetch:] see xaAniqN.

kirosiniY~N *
[or karosaniY~N] A sort of Him~aS. (The Minháj, in TA, art. HmS.)

kar$N *
or kiro$N The plant so named: see raqamapN.

kariySN *
A kind of A^aqiT: see kavo'N.

mikoraSN *
: i. q. miDorab, q. v.

1 karaEa fiY AlmaA='i *
, and fiY AlA_inaA='i, He put his mouth into the water, or into the vessel, and so drank. (See Eab~a.)

karAaEN *
: see Eid~N.

kuraAEN *
: see Har~apN, rakaDa, *iraAEN, and badanN.

kurosuwEN *
The prominent extremity of the ulna, next to the little finger, at the wrist. (S, * K.)

kurokiY~N *
The Numidian crane; ardea virgo: also called A_iwaz~N EirAaqiY~N, and waz~N EiraAqiY~N. See A^abuw AlEayozaAri and guronayoqN.

1 karuma *
, inf. n. karamN, It (a thing) was, or became, highly esteemed or prized or valued; excellent, precious, valuable, or rare: (Msb:) followed by Ealayohi: see 1 in art. fjE. ― -b2- karumato A^aroDuhu His land yielded increase of its seed-produce, (ISh, K,) and its soil became good, (ISh,) being manured; (ISh, K;) [or it was, or became, generous, or good; i. e., productive, or fertile]. ― -b3- karumotu Ealayohi, (S, K, art. Ez,) I exceeded him in generosity, or nobleness. (TK, voce Eaz~N.)

2 kar~amahu EalaY~a *
[He honoured him above me]. (Kur, xvii. 64). ― -b2- kar~amahu Eano ka*aA [He preserved him from such a thing]: see an ex. in a verse cited in art. El (conj. 3): and see, here, 4 and 5. ― -b3- kar~ama He highly regarded a horse or the like. ― -b4- See takorimapN.

4 A^akoramahu *
He treated him with honour, or courtesy. ― -b2- A^akorama, and ↓Aisotakorama, He found a generous horse (farasFA kariymFA). (TA in art. rbT.) See rabaTa. ― -b3- A^akoramotu Eanohu EiroDiY I preserved myself from it. (S in art. ErD. See also 2.)

5 takar~ama Eanohu *
, and ↓takaArama, He shunned it; avoided it; kept, or removed, himself far from it; or preserved himself from it; (K;) for in stance, from foul speech. (TA in art. dqE.) ― -b2- takar~ama He affected, or constrained himself, to be generous. (S.)

6 takaAorama
see 5.

10 Aisotakorama Al$~aYo'a *
: see 10 in art. frh. ― -b2- See also 4.

A_ibonu Alkaromi *
The qiTof [i. e. grape, or bunch of grapes]. (T in art. bnY.)

karamN *
in a horse, &c., generous quality. See HasabN; and see kariymN, and makorumapN, and $ariyfN.

*uw AljalaAli waAlA_ikoraAmi *
(Kur, lv. 27) Possessed of majesty, or greatness, and bounty: (Jel:) or, of absolute independence and universal bounty. (Bd.)

Alkurokumu AlS~agiyru *
: see AlEuruwqu AlS~uforu.

kariymN *
Generous; liberal; honourable: noble; high-born; contr. of lay^iymN. (K, &c.) ― -b2- [A generous, a noble, a high-bred, a well-born, or an excellent, horse, &c.; of generous, high, or good, breed or quality.] ― -b3- A thing highly esteemed or prized or valued; excellent, precious, valuable, or rare. (Msb.) ― -b4- [A^aroDN kariymapN Productive land. See karumato A^aroDuhu.] ― -b5- baEiyrN kariymN EalaY A^aholihi [A camel held in high estimation by his owner]. (TA in art. dfE.) ― -b6- [wajohu A@ll~`hi Alkariymu means The glorious face of God: see an ex. voce suboHapN.] ― -b7- karAay^imu AlmaAli (TA) or AlA^amowaAli (Mgh, Msb) Such as are held in high estimation, precious, or excellent, of cattle or other possessions; (Mgh, Msb, TA;) the choice, or best, thereof. (Mgh, Msb.)

Hub~FA wakaraAmapN *
, see Hub~N. ― -b2- laA walaA karaAmapF No; nor a jar-cover: i. e., No: (I will not give thee, or I will not do, what thou requirest,) nor anything else. See Hub~N; and see takorimap. ― -b3- karAamapN, the kind of miracle so called: pl. karaAmaAtN; like the term χαρίσματα as used by St. Paul in 1 Cor. xii. 9: it may be well rendered thaumaturgy: and SAaHibu karAamaAtK a thaumaturgus, or thaumaturgist: see muEojizahN, and qaraAsapN.

A^akoramu *
in the sense of kariymN, as in A^akoramuhumo A^abFA: see bayaADN.

takorimapN *
, syn. with takoriymN; (Mgh;) subst. from kar~amotuhu; as also ↓karaAmapN. (Msb.)

makoramapN *
A means. or cause, of attaining honour. (Mgh, Msb.)

makorumN *
: see A^aluwkN and yusorN.

makorumapN *
A generous, or honourable, quality or action. (Msb, &c.) ― -b2- EaliYa fiY AlmakaArimi [He became eminent in generous, or honourable, actions or practices or qualities or dispositions]. (Msb in art. Elw.) ― -b3- makaArimu may often be rendered Excellencies.

A^aroDN makorumapN *
and ↓karamN (tropical:) Generous, good, land: (K, TA:) [good and fertile land:] or dunged and tilled land. (TA.) And A^aroDN makorumapN liln~abaAvi (tropical:) Land producing good herbage or plants. (S,
TA. [In some copies of the S, good for herbage or plants.])

1 karihahu *
[He disliked, was displeased with, disapproved of, hated, him or it.] AlkaraAhapu is the contr. of AlA_iraAdapu and Alr~iDaY. (Marg. note in TA.) ― -b2- karihahu (Mgh, Msb), inf. n. karaAhapN and karaAhiyapN, (Mgh,) or kurohN and karohN, (Msb,) He did not desire it; he disapproved it, or was displeased or discontented with it; (Mgh;) he disliked it; disapproved it; hated it; contr. of Hab~ahu. (Msb.) ― -b3- kariha and ↓takar~aha: see saxiTa.

2 kar~ahotu A_ilayohi Al$~aYo'a *
, inf. n. takoriyhu, I made the thing to be an object of dislike, disapprobation, or hatred, to him. (S, K. *)

4 A^akorahotuhu EalaY kadaA *
I made him to do such a thing against his will. (S.)

5 takar~ahahu *
He showed, or expressed, dislike, disapprobation, or hatred, of it; see taAaj~amahu and tasax~aTahu: and Ealyohi ↓takaAraha signifies the same; see qanaHa. ― -b2- takar~aha He expressed dislike, displeasure, disapprobation, discontent, or hatred. (IbrD.) See examples in the K, voce A^ax~o, and voce A^af~o, &c. The above is the prevailing signification, and often occurs. ― -b3- takar~ahahu i. q. karihahu, q. v. (K, * TA.) See also taA^aj~amahu.

6 takaAoraha
see 5.

kariyhN *
Disliked, disapproved of, blamed, or hated; hateful, blameable, displeasing, or odious; as also ↓makoruwhN.

AlkarAahiyapu ll$~aYo'i *
signifies AlbugoDu lahu and Eadama mulaA'amatihi. (MF in art. AbY.)

kaArihN *
Unwilling: see an ex. voce A^asaA='a.

makorahN *
A thing that one dislikes, disapproves, or hates, or that one dislikes to do: opposed to mano$aTN: (TA in art. n$T:) [a thing, or an event, that is an object of dislike or hatred].

makoruwhN *
Foul, abominable, or evil; i. q. say~iy^N; (Beyd, xvii. 40;) and $ar~N: (TA:) [held in aversion]. See kariyhN. ― -b2- makaArihu, a pl. of makoruwhN. ― -b3- makaArihu Ald~ahori The afflictions, or calamities, of fortune; syn. nawaAziluhu and $adaAy^iduhu. (TA.) See also makorahN.

musotakorahN *
: see an ex. voce EaraDN.

3 kaAraY EalaY daAb~api *
He employed a beast of carriage to carry for hire. (IbrD.)

4 A^akorAaniY daArahu *
, and daAb~atahu, He let me his house, and his beast of carriage, on hire. (Mgh.)

6 takaAoraYa
see 8.

8 AikotaraY *
and ↓AisotakoraY and ↓takaAraY He hired, or took on hire a house, and a beast. (Mgh.)

10 A_isotakoraYa
see 8.

karFY *
or karFA Drowsiness. (S, Msb, K.)

kariY~N *
One who lets a thing on hire; (Mgh:) one who lets beasts on hire. (Msb.) See an ex. in a verse cited art. $m, conj. 4. ― -b2- And One who is hired. (Mgh, &c.) In one copy of the Mgh, AlmktriY is put by mistake for AlmukotaraY: i. q. mukorK: and mukotarFY. (TA in art. Hrm.)

kuriY~N *
Spherical: see Ksh in ii. 20.

kuriy~apN *
Sphericalness: see Bd in ii. 20.

karawoyA *
[Caraway-seed] is of the measure faEawolalN [and if so must be written karawoyFA]: (K:) or it may be faEawolFY: [but see what follows:] AHn says that, if with medd, it is fem. [and therefore karawoyaA='u]: but it is not Arabic [and therefore, without medd, it is probably karawoyaA]. (TA.)

karawaAnN *
: see DuwaEN and qabojN.

mukaArK *
One who lets beasts of carriage, &c., on hire; like kariY~N, q. v.; an owner, and letter on hire, of asses [&c.]. (KL.) See fal~aAHN.

kaAsifu AlbaAli *
: see baAlN.

kawosaqN *
i. q. kawosajN. (M.)

2 kas~alahu *
, inf. n. takosiylN, said of satiety, It rendered him heavy, sluggish, lazy, indolent, or torpid. (TA.)

4 A^akosala EanohaA *
signifies A^awolaja walamo yunozilo; [Inivit sed non emisit;] (IAar, in TA, art. fhr;) [i. e., A^awolaja vum~a tarakahaA walamo yunozilo].

kasolaAnN *
Heavy, sluggish, lazy, indolent, torpid. (K.)

makosalapN *
: see an ex. voce kiT~apN.

1 kasawotuhu sayofFA *
[I invested him with a sword]. (TA in art. g$w.)

5 tksY *
: see tqY.

kisaA='N *
[A garment]. See EabaA='N, and HilosN and musay~aHN. ― -b2- *uw kisaA='K, as opposed to *uwburodK, (assumed tropical:) A poor man. (S, art. Ej.) [The ksA' was evidently a simple oblong piece of cloth; for AlkisaAy^iY is said to have been thus named because he wore a ksA' while in the state of A_iHoraAm; as is mentioned in the TA, art. ksw; but it seems to have been sometimes sewed in the manner of the EabaA=', which see; and see also musay~aHN, and burodN.] It is [properly] not one of the garments which are cut and sewed [but is a single piece]: (Mgh, art. qTE:) [a wrapper, or wrapping garment, of a single piece]. ― -b3- rakiba kisaA='ahu He fell upon the back of his neck. (IAar, in TA, art. rdE.)

kaAsK *
Having clothing: see an ex. voce rub~a.

A^akosaY *
: see baSalN.

1 ka$afahu * and ka$afa Eanohu
He uncovered it; unveiled it; laid it open; displayed it; exposed it to view; discovered it; detected it; revealed it; disclosed it. ― -b2- ka$afa Eanohu He investigated, explored, or scrutinized, it; searched, examined, or inquired, into it. ― -b3- ka$afahu He removed it; namely, a cover, or covering, or the like: and he uncovered it, laid it open, &c.; as also ka$afa Eanohu. ― -b4- ka$afa $ayoA^F Eano $aYo'K He removed, put off, took off, or stripped off, a thing from over, or from before, a thing which it covered or concealed. (K.) ― -b5- ka$afa He removed, cleared away, or dispelled, grief, or sorrow: see faraja (of which it is an explanation in the Msb and K). ― -b6- See 7.

3 kaA$afahu *
, inf. n. mukaA$afapN, [He acted openly with him, or towards him;] syn. of the inf. n. mujaAharapN. (Har, p. 470.) He, or it, appeared to him; as also kaA$afa Ealayohi; syn. Zhr lh. (TA.) ― -b2- kuw$ifa bimaA A^axofayotu He became acquainted with, knew, or got knowledge of, what I concealed: syn. A_iT~alaEa Ealayohi. (Har. p. 686.) ― -b3- mukaA$afapN The showing open enmity, or hostility, with any one. (KL.) [I. e. kaA$afahu alone, or] kA$fh biAlEadaAwapi signifies He showed open enmity, or hostility, with him; (S, MA, K;) and so kA$fh AlEadaAwapa. (MA.) See SafoHapN. ― -b4- [Also Discovery, or revelation: pl. mukaA$afaAtN: see Hájjee Khaleefeh, s. v.] ― -b5- kaA$afahu AlHaroba [He made war with him openly]. (Msb, art. nb*.)

5 taka$~afa *
He uncovered, or exposed, himself in sitting. (TA, voce A^aEofatu.)

6 takaA$afuwA *
They revealed their faults, or secrets, one to another: see tadaAfanuwA.

7 Ainoka$afa Eanohu *
[He, or it, withdrew, or became withdrawn, or removed or became removed, from him, or it, or from over it] ― -b2- Ainoka$afato said of a she-camel: see mufan~anN. ― -b3- Ainoka$afuwA [They were
routed, defeated, or put to flight; like ↓ka$ifuwA: the former is quasi-pass. of ka$afa, “ he routed, ” &c.]. (K, voce jAl in art. jwl.) See also tiforijapN, in art. frj.

ka$~aAfN *
: see Ham, p. 49, 1. 2.

mako$uwfN *
Uncovered, &c.; overt.

mukaA$ifN *
[A discoverer, or revealer: thus I have rendered it voce EayonN.]

ka$okN *
Barley-water: (K:) or pounded wheat or barley: a Persian word, arabicized. (Mgh.) Hence, ka$okiy~apN A kind of broth. (Mgh.)

1 kaZama gayoZahu *
He repressed, or restrained, his wrath, or rage. (K.) ― -b2- kaZama, aor.
kaZima
, inf. n. kaZomN, He restrained himself. (TA.) ― -b3- maA yakoZimu EalaY jir~apK; and laA yakoZimN EalaY jir~atihi: see jir~apN. ― -b4- kaZama EalaY gayoZihi i. q. kaZama gayoZahu. (TA.)

kaZaAy^imu *
[pl. of kiZaAmapN] Subterranean conduits for water. (TA in art. qnw.)

kuEoburapN *
and ↓kuEobuwrapN Anything compact (K, TA) and round: (TA:) and the latter, i. q. EuqodapN [meaning a knot, or a knob]: (TA:) [pl. of the latter kaEaAbiyru: see xirowN: see also A^axoramu]. ― -b2- Also The seed-vessel [i. e. siliqua, or pod,] of the radish and some other plants. (IAar, TA voce A_isoHaAr~N.)

kuEobuworapN *
: see kuEoburapN.

kaEokN *
A well-known bread; (K;) biscuit; (MA;) or [a kind of] dry bread: (MA, TA:) now applied to a sort of bread made in the form of a ring, hollow, [and generally containing some dbs or the like,] the best of which is brought from Syria, and given as a present. (TA.)

kuEalN *
: see vuEalN.

1 kaEama AlbaEiyra *
: see Eakama.

kiEaAmN *
A muzzle for a camel. (PS.)

kiEaAmapN *
The iron thing that embraces, or clasps, (talotaqimu,) the muzzle of the horse. (IDrd in his book on the Saddle and Bridle, p. 8.)

1 kaf~a Alt~awoba *
He sewed the edge, or border, of the garment, or piece of cloth, the second time, (S, K,) after the [slight] sewing termed Almal~u, (S,) or Al$~al~u. (K.) ― -b2- [He felled (a seam or garment).] ― -b3- kaf~a Eanohu, aor.
kafu3a
, He refrained, or forbore, from it, as forbidden; abstained, or desisted, from it; left, relinquished, or forsook it: (Msb:) [as also ↓Ankf~]. ― -b4- kaf~a Eanohu He refrained, desisted, forbore, abstained, or held, from it. (K, &c.) ― -b5- kaf~ahu Eanohu He made him to refrain, forbear, or abstain, from it; averted him, turned him away or back, from it; (K;) prevented, hindered, held, withheld, or restrained, him from it. (Mgh, Msb, TA.) ― -b6- [kaf~a bayonahumaA He interposed as a restrainer between them two: a phrase of frequent occurrence]. ― -b7- kaf~a mina Al$~aEari (M, K, art. qSr) He shortened the hair. (M, ibid.)

3 kaAf~uwA Eaduw~ahumo *
i. q. HaAjazuwhumo, which see. ― -b2- mukaAf~apN signifies i. q. muHaAjazapN, because it is a preventing, or an abstaining, from fighting. (Mgh.)

7 A_inokafa3a
see 1.

kaf~N *
[generally The hand: sometimes, app., the palm only:] accord. to Az, the palm with the fingers. (Msb.) ― -b2- [Hence, A cake of the length and thickness of the hand: thus in the present day. See Euj~aAlN.] ― -b3- kaf~N A handful; what one takes with the hand, or grasps; syn. quboDapN. (S, art. qbD.) ― -b4- [Darabahu kaf~FA He struck him a slap with the hand.] ― -b5- [kaf~N often signifies The paw of a beast.] ― -b6- Alkaf~u Alja*omaA='u The star α of Cetus. ― -b7- Alkaf~u AlxaDiybu The β of Cassiopeia.

kaf~apN *
: see kif~apN.

kuf~apN *
The selvage, i. e. border, or side, of a garment or piece of cloth, (S, Msb,) that has no hudob [or end of unwoven threads]: (S, voce Tur~apN:) or what surrounds the skirt of a shirt: or whatever is oblong; as the HaA$iyap of a garment or piece of cloth, and of sand: and the edge of a thing. (K.)

kif~apN *
The bezel, or collet, i. e. the part in which the stone is set, of a signet-ring. (TA in art. rkb.) See kurosiY~N. ― -b2- See also TaroqN. ― -b3- kif~apN A scale of a balance: (MA:) vulg. ↓kaf~apN. (K.)

kafaAfN *
The like of a thing. (S, K.) ― -b2- Food, or sustenance, that renders one independent of others: (S, K:) or sufficient for one's want, not exceeding nor falling short. (Msb.)

kifaAfN *
The circuit, rim, or surrounding edge, of a thing. (S, K.)

kifaAfapN *
[app. a subst., not an inf. n.,] The act, or art, of sewing in the manner termed kaf~N; (TA;) contr. of $ilaA$apN. (TA in art. $l.)

naAqapN kaAf~apN *
An old and weak she-camel. (AO, TA in art. sdm.) ― -b2- [maA kaAf~apN The restrictive maA, which is annexed to A^an~a A_in~a, &c.: so called because it restrains the particle to which it is adjoined from exercising any government.] ― -b3- kaAf~apF Wholly. (Bd and Jel in ii. 204.)

Harofu mukaAfaA^apK *
A particle denoting compensation, or the complement of a condition; like Harofu jazaA='K.

1 kafala baAlmaAli *
He was, or became, responsible, answerable, accountable, amenable, surety, or guarantee, for the property (Msb) owed by another person: (IbrD:) [it may be rendered he guaranteed the property. See makofuwlN]. ― -b2- kafala baAln~afosi He was, or became, responsible, answerable, amenable, or surety, for another person, (Msb,) i. e., for the latter's appearance, or presence, to answer a suit. (IbrD.)

kafalN *
The Eajuz [or hinder part, posteriors, buttocks, or rump]: (Msb, K:) or the ridof [or hindermost part] thereof: or the [part called] qaTan. (K.)

kafiylN *
One who is responsible, answerable, amenable, or a sponsor or surety. (S, K, &c.)

kafaAlapN *
Responsibility; answerableness; amenability; or suretiship; (S, Mgh, Msb, K;) the conjoining of one responsibility (*im~ap) to another, [i. e., the conjoining one's own responsibility to that of another person,] with respect to the right of suit, [so that one person becomes liable to be sued for that which another owes]; (Mgh;) i. q. DamaAnN. (S, &c.)

mikofaAlN *
A woman large in the kafal [or hinder part, or posteriors]. (TA in art. vql.)

makofuwlN *
app. signifies Guaranteed, or pledged: for, accord. to IKtt, as is said in the Msb, you say kafalotu AlmaAla as well as kafalotu biAlmaAli; meaning I took upon myself the property; became responsible, or answerable, for it; [or I guaranteed it:] or makofuwlN is better rendered ensured by an acknowledgment of responsibility for it: see an ex. voce marohuwnN.

5 takaf~anuwA bA^anoTaAEK *
[They wrapped themselves with AnTAE for grave-clothing]. (TA, art. HnT.)

4 Aikofahara *
, said of clouds: see a verse cited EazolaA='u.

1 kafaY *
He, or it, sufficed, or contented: hence kafaAniY fulaAnN AlA^amora Such a one sufficed me, or contented me, in respect of the affair; i. e., by taking upon himself to perform it or accomplish it if good, or to prevent it or avert it if evil: and kafaAniY $ahiydFA He sufficed me as, or for, a witness; or he suffices me as, or for, such: and sometimes bi is redundantly prefixed to its agent, and sometimes to its objective complement; as in exs. cited in art. b. See Ham, p. 152. kafaY [It sufficed, or satisfied, or contented,] it stood instead of another thing, or other things; (Msb;) [as also kafaY Eano gayorihi.] ― -b2- kafaY binaA for kafaAnaA &c. See W, pp. 5 and 6 ― -b3- kafaY, aor. yakofiY, inf. n. kifaAyapN, also signifies dafaEa and manaEa followed by mino. (Har, p. 43, q. v.) [You say, kafaAhu Al$~ar~a He repelled from him evil; and hence, he defended him therefrom; and he freed him therefrom: said of God, and of a man, &c.]

8 AikotafaY biAl$~aYo'i *
He was, or became, sufficed by the thing, so as to need nothing more; or content with it. (Msb.)

kifaAyapN *
A sufficiency; enough; a thing that suffices, or contents, and enables one to obtain what one seeks. (TA, art. blg.) ― -b2- qaAma bikifaAyatihi He undertook his maintenance; he maintained him; syn. maAnahu. (S, K, art. mwn.)

A^akofaY *
[More, and most, satisfying]. (Mgh, in art. jzA^.)

kaAkanajN *
or kaAkanojN [Pers. kaAkonajo]: see EubabN.

1 kal~a *
It (the sight) was, or became, dim, dull, or hebetated. (K.) ― -b2- He (a camel) was, or became, fatigued, tired, or wearied. (MA.) ― -b3- kal~ati AlA^ayodiY The hands, or arms, became weak; syn. DEft [i. e. DaEaufato]. (Ham, 296.) [kal~a Eano fiEolK He was fatigued, or weak, and so disabled, or incapacitated, from doing a thing; like A^aEoyaA Eanohu, and DaEaufa Eanohu: see nuxiba and Earisa.] ― -b4- kal~ato A^asonaAnuhu, (K, art. Drs,) inf. n. kalaAlN, (S, in that art.,) His teeth were set on edge, (TK, in that art.,) by eating, or drinking, what was acid, or sour. (S, K, in that art.) ― -b5- kal~a It (a sword, &c.) was blunt, and would not cut. (K, &c.) ― -b6- kul~atuhun~a for kul~uhun~a: see Bd xxxi., last verse.

2 kal~ala *
He adorned a thing with gems or jewels.

4 A^akal~a A^asonaAnahu *
[It set his teeth on edge]; said of acid, or sour, food or drink. (Ibn-'Abbád, in TA, art. Drs.) See 1.

kal~N *
A burden; syn. viqolN: (S, Mgh, Msb, K:) a person, or persons, whom one has to support: syn. Eay~alN, (K,) and EiyaAlN: (S, Mgh, Msb, K:) applied to one and to more. (Msb.) See an ex. voce *im~apN (last sentence but two).

kul~N *
when preceded by a negative and followed by an exception, means Any one; as in the Kur, xxxviii. 13, A_ino kul~N A_il~aA ka*~aba Alr~usula There was not any one but accused the apostles of lying. See also another ex. voce lam~aA. ― -b2- See baEoD. ― -b3- huwa AlEaAlimu kul~u AlEaAlimi [lit. He is the possessor of knowledge, the entirety of the possessor of knowledge,] means that he is one who has attained to the utmost degree of the quality thus attributed to him. (Sb, K, TA.) ― -b4- kul~amaA Whatever. ― -b5- kul~amaA Whenever; as often as; every time that; in proportion as. ― -b6- kul~amano Whoever.

kil~apN *
[musquito-curtain]: see A^abuw divaArK and baEaDa.

kul~iY~N *
Relating to all or the whole; universal; total: and often meaning relating to the generality; general; contr. of juzoy^iY~N. ― -b2- And, as a subst., A universal; that which comprises all juzoy^iy~aAt, or particulars: pl. kul~iy~aAtN. ― -b3- kul~iy~apN The quality of relating to all or the whole; relation to all or the whole; universality; totality: and often meaning the quality of relating to the generality; generality. ― -b4- Alkul~iy~aAtu Alxamosu, in logic, The Five Predicables: namely, Aljinosu Genus, Aln~awoEu Species, AlfaSolu Difference, AlxalS~apu Property, and AlEaraDu Accident.

kaliylN *
Weak, or faint, lightning [app. likened to a blunt sword]. (TA in art. Eml.) ― -b2- kaliylu AlZ~ufori: see ZuforN. ― -b3- lisaAnN kaliylN A dull tongue; lacking sharpness. (S. *)

wariva rajulFA kalaAlapF *
, and Eano kalaAlapK, He was heir of a man who left neither parent nor offspring (IbrD.)

AlA_ikoliylu *
The 17th Mansion of the Moon; (Kzw;) the head of Scorpio. (Aboo-l-Heythem, quoted in the TA, voce raqiybN.) ― -b2- AlA_ikoliylu Three bright stars in [or rather before] the head of Scorpio, [namely g, h, and q,] disposed in a row, transversely. ― -b3- The border of flesh round the nail: (K:) in the TA, art. $Zf, A_ikoliylu AlZ~ufuri.

mukal~alN *
Adorned with gems or jewels. (L, art. njd; a common meaning.)

1 kalifa bihi *
He became attached, addicted, given, or devoted, to it; or he attached, addicted, gave, or devoted, himself to it; (S, Msb, K, TA;) he loved it: (Msb, TA:) [he was fond of it:] he loved him, [or it,] vehemently. (TA.) ― -b2- kalafN, inf. n. of kalifa: [violent or intense love:] see Hub~N; and see a verse cited in the first paragraph of that art.

2 kal~afa nafosahu $ayoy^FA *
He tasked himself with a thing, as also ↓takal~afa $ayy^FA. ― -b2- kal~afahu A^amorFA He tasked him to do a thing; imposed upon him the task of doing a thing. ― -b3- So takoliyfN The imposition of a task or duty. ― -b4- A task; compulsory work; a duty imposed. ― -b5- kal~afahu AlA^amora He imposed upon him the thing, or affair; syn. Ham~alahu A_iy~aAhu. (Msb.) ― -b6- kal~afa nafosahu He put himself to trouble or inconvenience; like ↓takal~afa alone. ― -b7- kal~afahu ka*aA He imposed upon him the task of doing, or procuring, or bringing, such a thing. ― -b8- kal~afahu A^amorFA He imposed upon him a thing, or an affair, in spite of difficulty, trouble, or inconvenience: (Msb:) he ordered him to do a thing that was difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient, to him: (S, K:) he made, required, or constrained, him to do a thing; exacted of him the doing a thing; meaning, a thing that was difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient to him: (Kull, 123; and the Lexicons, passim.) See jat~amahu. ― -b9- takoliyfN An imposition; a requisition: con straint, &c.

5 takal~afa A^amorFA *
He [undertook a thing, or an affair, as imposed upon him: or] took, or imposed, upon himself, or undertook, a thing, or an affair, [as a task, or] in spite of difficulty, trouble, or inconvenience; (Msb;) syn. tajat~amahu: (S, K:) he constrained, or tasked, or exerted, himself, or took pains, or made an effort, to do a thing; meaning, a thing that was difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient, to him: or he affected, as a self-imposed task, the doing of a thing. (The Lexicons, passim: see tgz~l: and see kal~afahu A^amorFA.) ― -b2- tkl~f SifapF He affected, or endeavoured to acquire, a quality. So in the explanations of verbs of the measure tafaE~ala; as naHal~ama. (Sharh El-'Izzee, by Saad-ed-Keen.) ― -b3- Also, He affected, or pretended to have, a quality, not having it. So in the explanations of verbs of the measure tafaAEala, as tajaAhala: (idem:) [and sometimes in verbs of the measure tafaE~ala also, as takas~ara &c.]. And takal~afa alone, He exercised self-constraint, or put himself to trouble or inconvenience. ― -b4- takal~afa He affected what was not
natural to him. ― -b5- takal~afa He used forced efforts to do a thing, and to appear to have a quality. He affected, or endeavoured to do or acquire, &c.; he constrained himself to do, &c.; he applied himself, as to a task, to do a thing. tkl~f Al$~ajaAEapa He made himself, or constrained himself to be, courageous; affected, or endeavoured to acquire, or characterize himself by, courage. ― -b6- tkl~f Al$~ajaAEapa also, He acted, or behaved, with forced courage; endeavoured to be courageous. ― -b7- tkl~f fiY Earabiy~atihi He used a forced, or affected, manner in his Arabic speech. ― -b8- takal~ufN A straining of a point in lexicology. ― -b9- taEaq~ala signifies He affected or endeavoured to acquire, intelligence; explained by tkl~f AlEaqola: and taEaAqala, he pretended to be intelligent, not being really so. (S, art. Eql.) takal~ufN in a verb of the measure tafaE~ala is as above explained, signifying a desire for the existence of an attribute in one's self: in a verb of the measure tafaAEala it is different, and means the pretending to be or to do something which in reality one is not or does not; as in the instance of tajaAhala, he pretended to be ignorant, not being so in reality. (Sharh El-'Izzee, by Saad-ed-Deen.) takal~afa ka*aA He did so purposely. ― -b10- takal~afa He tasked himself. ― -b11- takal~afa AlqaYo'a He vomited intentionally. (TA, art. qY'.)

kalafN *
[A discolouration of the face, by] a thing that comes upon the face resembling sesame; [by freckles, accord. to present usage:] and a dingy redness that comes upon the face. (S, K.)

kulofapN *
A difficulty, or difficult affair, or a duty, or an obligation, that one imposes upon himself; (S, K;) or a thing imposed upon one as difficult, troublesome, or inconvenient. (Msb.) See Hab~N. ― -b2- [Constraint,] trouble, pain, or inconvenience. (MA.)

3 kaAlamahu *
i. q. naATaqahu. (TA in art. nTq.)

5 takal~ama ganohu *
He spoke for him; syn. Eab~ara. (S, Msb, art. Ebr.)

6 takaAlamaA *
They spoke, talked, or discoursed, each with the other. (S, * M.)

kalimapN *
A word: (Kull, 301:) an expression: (K:) a proposition: a sentence: [a saying:] an argument. (Kull.) An assertion: an expression of opinion.

kalaAmN *
is a gen. n., applying to little and to much, or to few or many; (S, TA;) to what is a sing. and to what is a pl. (TA.) It may therefore be rendered A saying, &c.; and sayings, or words: see an ex. voce A^afokalu, in art. fkl. ― -b2- kalaAmN Speech; something spoken; [diction; language;] parlance; talk; discourse: (Msb, &c.:) a saying: a say: something said: in grammar, a sentence. Alkalimu AlT~ay~ibu: see Tay~itN. ― -b3- kalaAmN: also, a quasi-inf. n. for tklym, sometimes governing as a verb, [like the inf. n.,] accord. to some of the grammarians; as in the following ex.:
qAlwA klAmk hndAF whY mSgyp
y$fyk qlt SHyH *Ak lw kAnA
(Sharh Shudhoor edh-Dhahab.) See A_isomu maSodarK. ― -b4- Eilomu AlkalaAmi [The theology of the Muslims;] a science in which one investigates the being and attributes of God, and the conditions of possible things with respect to creation and restitution, according to the rule of El-Islám; which last restriction is for the exclusion of the theology of the philosophers. (KT.)

rajulN kil~iymN *
, like sik~iyt~ [and Hid~iyvN] i. q. minoTiyqN. (Ibn-'Abbád, Z, TA.)

kuloyapN *
of a bow: see A^aboharu ― -b2- of a mazaAdap: see xurobapN.

mutakal~imN *
A Muslim theologian. See Eilomu AlkalaAmi.

1 kalaA *
, first pers. kalaAtu, aor. yakoluw; and kalaA, first pers. kalayotu, aor. yakolaA; inf. n., kilaAyapN; see kalaA^a.

AlkulaY *
: the feathers so called: see manaAkibu and A^aboharu.

AlkuloyataAni *
A name of two stars on the ear of Taurus. (See AlkalobaAni.)

kamo *
: see its syn. kaA^aY~K or kaA^ay~ino voce A^aY~N. ― -b2- As an interrogative with the specification suppressed, What number? How many? and, as in an ex. voce siqoYN, virtually meaning How much? and so in an ex. voce masaAfapN and voce $aborN. Also How long? as in the Kur, ii. 161, &c.; a noun signifying a period of time being understood: see also an ex. voce Easafa, and voce fara$a.

kam~N *
and kamN are both app. right: see qado.

kim~N *
The calyx of a flower. (K, &c.) ― -b2- kim~N The envelope [or spathe] of the TaloE [or spadix of a palm-tree]: and the covering [or calyx] of flowers or blossoms; as also ↓kimaAmapN. (S, Msb, K.)

kum~apN *
A qalanosuwap: (TA in art. bTH:) or a round qlnswp: (S, K:) pl. kimaAmN. (K, * TA in art. bTH.)

kimaAmapN *
: see kim~N.

kam~iy~apN *
Quantum, or quantity, as answering to “ how many. ”

mukam~amN *
Covered over, or concealed (masotuwr). (S, art. xSb.) See buroA^ap.

kamokaAmN *
The cancamum-tree: see buTomN and DirowN.

kamaA fiyoTuws *
[ χαμαίπιτυς, the ground-pine]: see EaroSafN.

entryFree.hi: A kind of belt with a receptacle for money.

div2.entryFree:
1 kamala *
He, or it, was, or became, perfect; and sometimes, it was, or became, complete, entire, whole, or full; which latter signification is more properly expressed by tam~a, which see.

kaAmlN *
Complete with respect to bodily vigour, having attained the usual term thereof. See layovu Eifir~iyna, art. Efr. Also Consummate, perfect.

Eayonu AlkamaAli *
: see faqaA^a.

AlkaAmaAnu Almu*aAbu *
, mentioned in the TA, in art. nbT, i. q. Eiloku AlA^anobaAT, which is applied as a lzwq to a wound.

makomanN *
A place of concealment, a lurking-place: (Mgh, Msb:) pl. makaAminu. (Msb.)

A^aroDN kamohaA='N *
i. q. mugim~apN and migam~apN. (TA in art. gm.)

kamiY~N *
A courageous man: or one wearing arms or armour: (K:) or a courageous man covered, or protected, by arms or armour; (S;) a courageous armed man.

kin~N *
A place of retreat or concealment; such as a cave, and an excavated house or chamber: (Beyd, xvi. 83:) see bar~N. ― -b2- kin~N The shelter of a wall: see difo'N. ― -b3- A thing that serves for veiling, covering, or protecting. (S, * Msb, * K.) See Zil~N, where I have thus rendered it.

kun~apN *
: see TanafN.

kinaAnapN *
: see jaEobapN.

kaAnuwnN *
A fire-place; a place in which fire is lighted. (S, K.)

makonuwnu AlfaAy^ili *
: see a verse of El-Aashà in art. fyl.

fAEl musotakin~N *
: see musotaqinN.

kanoxabapN *
Confusion of speech, or discourse, by reason of errors, or mistakes. (Yoo, K.) [App. an inf. n. of which the verb is kanoxaba.]

kaniysN *
[a kind of roast flesh-meat]: see maromuwDN.

8 Aikotanafahu Alqawomu *
The people were on his right and left. (Msb.) ― -b2- Aikotanafahu It bordered it on either side.

kanafN *
Vicinage or neighbourhood, or region or quarter or tract, and shadow or shelter or protection. (K.) ― -b2- kanafaA AlA_inosaAni The man's two sides, right and left. (TA.)

kanuwfN *
: see qa*uwrN, in two places.

kaniyfN *
: see zirobN.

kunaAfapN *
A kind of pastry, resembling vermicelli, made of fine flour and water mixed in such proportions as to compose a thin paste, which is poured into a vessel whose bottom is pierced with numerous small holes: the vessel being then moved circuitously over a large round tray of tinned copper, beneath which is a fire, the paste runs in fine streams, is quickly but slightly baked. and swept off. For eating, it is slightly baked with clarified butter (smn), and then sweetened with honey, or sometimes with treacle, or sugar. ― -b2- kunaAfapN i. q. Pers. ri$otaho qaTaAy^ifo [Thread katáïf]. (KL.) See A_iToriyapN.

kanafaAniY~N *
A maker or seller of kunaAfap.

mukaAnifN *
A she-camel that lies down behind the other camels. (Az, cited in L, art. rwH.)

4 A^akonaha *
: see an ex. in a verse cited voce maEas~N.

kunohN *
: see faS~N. ― -b2- kunohN may often be rendered Entity.

1 kanaY *
He affixed a kinaAyap, meaning, with the Koofees, a pronoun, to a verb [&c.]: (TA in art. ryb:) but accord. to the usage of the verb in two instances in the M and K, voce raAba in art. ryb, it clearly means he spoke allusively. ― -b2- kanaYa bihi Eano kadam, He used it metonymically for such a word or phrase; he alluded thereby to such a thing.

kinaAyapN *
A metonymy: see taEoriyDN; where the difference between these two words is explained. ― -b2- Also, An allusion. (TA.) ― -b3- Also, and ↓mukan~FY, accord. to De Sacy, in his Ar. Gr. i. 455, or ↓mukan~K, for I find its plural written in a copy of the S mukan~iyaAt, A pronoun; see kanaY.

mukan~K *
and mukan~aY:see kinaAyapN.

kuhobapN *
, accord. to Ibn El-Aarábee, Yellowness inclining to redness. (TA. voce Husobap.)

8 Aikotahala *
, said of a plant, It became tall and full-grown: (TA:) or it became of its full height, and blossomed: (S:) see zaAxirN.

kaholN *
Of middle age; or between that age and the period when his hair has become intermixed with heaviness. See $abaAbN; and $ayoxN and gulaAmN.

kuhuwlapN *
: see $abaAbN.

kaAhilN *
[The withers of a horse, &c.] i. q. HaArikN: or the anterior portion of the upper part of the back, next the neck, which is the upper third part, containing six vertebra: or the part between the two shoulder-blades: or the part where the neck is joined to the back how: [the base of the neck: see vabajN]. (K.)

kihaAnapN *
Divination: soothsaying. (K, &c.)

kaAhinN *
: see Ear~aAfN and EaAy^ifN.

kuw~apN *
and kaw~apN (S, Msb, K) and kaw~N (K) A hole, or perforation. or an aperture, (S, Mgh, Msb, K,) in a wall (Msb, K) or chamber; (S, Mgh;] [a mural aperture;] or the first and second, a small one; and the third, a large one (K.) See also mi$okaApN.

kArY *
[kaAriY~N?] i. q. gariybN, applied to a man. (AA, in TA, voce gariybN.)

kuwEN *
The extremity of the radius, or bone of the fore-arm, next the thumb: (S, Msb, K:) or the protuberance formed thereby.

5 takaw~afa *
: see ta$aA^~ama.

kaAfN *
Same as kus~N (because it is the name of the incipient letter of this word: 1001 Nights ii. 304).

kuwfiy~apN *
A thing that is worn upon the head; so called because of its roundness, or its bring round. (TA.)

8 AikotaAma *
He walked upon the extremities of his toes, by choice. (TA, voce HaAriqapN, q. v.)

1 kaAna *
He or it was. A verb of the class called incomplete, (naAqiSN) because, with the agent which it comprises, or to which it relates, it cannot constitute a complete proposition; i. e., non-attributive. The other verbs of this class are, Zal~a A^aDoHaY A^amosaY A^aSobaHa SaAra, maA daAma maAA@nofak~a maA fatiy^a maAbariHa maA zaAla baAta, and layosa. Each of these governs its noun, or subject, in the nom. case, and its enunciative, or predicate, in the acc. case; as, kaAna zayodN qaAy^imFA Zeyd was standing. ― -b2- (The n in yakuno and the like is often irregularly elided.) ― -b3- kaAna, divested of all signification of time. is often used as a copula. (See De Sacy 's Gr. Ar. i. 196.) So too is kaAy^inN; for h`*aA zayodN and h`*aA kaAy^inN zayodFA signify the same. (Mughnee, voce A^an~a.) ― -b4- kaAna as a complete, i. e., an attributive, verb, see HaSala. in three places.

5 takaw~ana *
He, or it, received, or took, his, or its, being, or existence; came into existence; originated.

10 AisotakaAna *
He was, or became lowly, humble, submissive, or in a state of abasement. (Har, p. 4, q. v.) See Aisotakana in art. skn: and see art. kyn.

entryFree.key: naEuw*u biAll~`hi mn AlHawori baEoda Alkawoni

div2.entryFree:
naEuw*u biAll~`hi mn AlHawori baEoda Alkawoni *
: see HaworN and kaworN.

kayonuwnapN *
: see $aAxa.

makaAnapN *
A particular place of being or existence. See an ex. voce nafosN. ― -b2- makaAnaka wazayodFA [Keep where thou art and approach not Zeyd!] Heard by Ks. (L, art. End.) ― -b3- State, or condition. [Bd, xi. 122, and xxxix. 40.) See art. mkn. ― -b4- makaAnN i. q. manozilapN. (Bd, xii. 77.) ― -b5- h`*aA makaAnN liqawolinaA ka*aA This is a ground for our saying thus. ― -b6- A^aSobaHa makaAna ka*aA It became as, or like, such a thing. See a verse cited voce ratomN.

1 kawaAhu *
He (a veterinary, and any other, TA) cauterized him; i. e. burned his skin; with an iron, and the like: (K:) or he burned him with fire. (Mgh.)

kay~aisN *
Intelligent; ingenious, clever. (S, Msb, K.) [Plur. kuwsaY:] also A^akoyaAsN. (Msb.)

A^um~u kayosaAna *
a metonymical name of The knee, in the dial. of El-Azd. (TA, art. rkb)

kiySN *
: see daniyqN.

2 kay~afotuhu fatakay~afa *
, used by the Muslim theologians, (K, TA,) verbs derived from kayofa, (TA,) [signifying I specified by the ascription of its quality and it became so specified,] are formed in accordance with analogy, not heard from the Arabs. (K, * TA.)

5 takay~afa *
: see what next precedes.

kayofiy~apN *
Quality as answering to “ how? ”; mode, or manner, of being.

kayofuwfiy~apN *
for kayofiy~apN: see tayosiy~apN.

8 AikotaAla Ealayohi * and minohu
: see EalaY in the sense of mino.

kayolN *
: see mikoyaAlN.

kay~aAlN *
[A measurer of corn and the like]. (A, art. bxs.)

mikoyaAlN *
A measure with which corn is measured; (S, Msb, K;) as also ↓kayolN; (Msb;) a measure of capacity.

10 AisotakaAna *
: see Aisotakana in art. skn: and see art. kwn.

kayonN *
(also written kayonapN, K, voce zaronabN): see baZorN.

kayohFA *
A large, or bulky, she-camel: see the last sentence in art. g*w.
